item.title: Help :)
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

I would try making your bitmap shorter. Perhaps try just using a bitmap of “Fish”. Are you sure you are using the bitmaps right? Try reading up on this tutorial or this one

To answer your question about findcolor I’ll quote the Scar help manual (can be reached by hitting F1 in SCAR or going to ‘Help’ menu):

function FindColor(var x, y: Integer; color, xs, ys, xe, ye: Integer): Boolean; Find color in box specified by xs, ys, xe, ye starting from left to right. Returns True if color found, the coordinates of the color if found is put in x,

Also I recommend that if you wish to further your knowledge of SCAR you visit SRL. SRL community is more SCAR-based and will be able to provide you help better than this community.

Read full topic

if (findcolor(x,y,bankercolor, 209, 207, 304, 277))then

Untitled := BitmapFromString(41, 10, ‘beNqlU+0KgzAMTKHi7LDI’ +

item.title: Help :)
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

Ok I took a look at your bitmap. Your problem is that you didn’t black out the background behind the text. In order for SCAR to be able to read/interpert/find text the bitmap has to be made with a black background. SCAR ignores the color black when it is searching for a bitmap and therefore “focuses” on the text you want it to find. Try putting that image in paint/gimp, zooming in and blacking out the background.

I would also try the function “FindBitmapTol” with a tolerance of about 5-10 (play around with it and see what works best). Runescape changes colors slightly from server to server, this will help make your script more “universal” across all servers.

Also I standardized your code to make it more readable for everybody:

[code]program New;

const
watercolor= 5190688;
watercolor2 = 12433592;
watercolor3 = 5976092;

var
x,y,Untitled : integer;

procedure pic;
begin
Untitled := BitmapFromString(41, 10, ‘beNqVlMEOhCAMRPl/jRuN’ +
‘xo2H9eTJj2SLI2MtVXfJHGqBvraA41IPy2u0aqckMWRWVPVJMcYQA’ +
‘qewLIhTK4Sqm6m6m5shGZyVz7rLGixUo4WIBOI2ZC/XiBiQg9nu2h’ +
‘BXaARkZECjGqmQftGfFg16NoRo+nB41DLJgQFLw3WirlO3t2TK4Cf’ +
‘bSzLmxFxK6XQO2kWrg9BHozuAgM17NRTTc50PCr9Ea3recoNup9Vt’ +
‘OIa5ZvdVy8WwCbg34RbN+1ZWjcL/Puunhpue7+sVHd3+veEaZ56kl’ +
‘CyC3X8Om93GL0W/XGEhH75H2vRzu16Z0IjzBafledQ=’);
end;

procedure find;
begin
If(findcolor(x,y,watercolor,209, 207, 304, 277))or
(findcolor(x,y,watercolor2,209, 207, 304, 277))or
(findcolor(x,y,watercolor3,209, 207, 304, 277))then
begin
wait(1000);
clickmouse(x,y,false);
wait(2000)
if (findbitmap(Untitled,x,y))then
begin
wait(3000);
clickmouse(x,y,true);
end;
end;
end;

begin
repeat
pic;
find;
until(false)
end.[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Help :)
item.dc:creator: @CDR CDR
item.description:
@CDR wrote:

I made a script and used 2 different bitmaps. Neither one is working. I made a fishing script so it first right clicks but then scar can’t find the bitmap and right clicks again. (RSC)

program New;
const
watercolor= 5190688;
watercolor2 = 12433592;
watercolor3 = 5976092;
var
x,y,Untitled : integer;
procedure pic;
begin
Untitled := BitmapFromString(41, 10, ‘beNqVlMEOhCAMRPl/jRuN’ +
‘xo2H9eTJj2SLI2MtVXfJHGqBvraA41IPy2u0aqckMWRWVPVJMcYQA’ +
‘qewLIhTK4Sqm6m6m5shGZyVz7rLGixUo4WIBOI2ZC/XiBiQg9nu2h’ +
‘BXaARkZECjGqmQftGfFg16NoRo+nB41DLJgQFLw3WirlO3t2TK4Cf’ +
‘bSzLmxFxK6XQO2kWrg9BHozuAgM17NRTTc50PCr9Ea3recoNup9Vt’ +
‘OIa5ZvdVy8WwCbg34RbN+1ZWjcL/Puunhpue7+sVHd3+veEaZ56kl’ +
‘CyC3X8Om93GL0W/XGEhH75H2vRzu16Z0IjzBafledQ=’);

   end;

procedure find;
begin
If(findcolor(x,y,watercolor,209, 207, 304, 277))or
(findcolor(x,y,watercolor2,209, 207, 304, 277))or
(findcolor(x,y,watercolor3,209, 207, 304, 277))then
begin
wait(1000);
clickmouse(x,y,false);
wait(2000)
if (findbitmap(Untitled,x,y))then
begin
wait(3000);
clickmouse(x,y,true);
end;
end;
end;
begin
repeat
pic;
find;
until(false)
end.
